item.title: Making of a Dress Form. Part 2. The Plaster Mold
item.description: When the praparation with all the materials, a place & a right pose for my future dress form was done, we were ready to get to the point. We’ve decided, that the final plaster mould would consist of two layers: one horizontal & one vertical. Each layer would be made of 3 layers of plaster bandage. So, it will be 6 layers thick. This will make the mould firm enough to keep the shape & not get wet with moisture from papier-mache.

item.title: Making of a Dress Form. Part 1. The Beginning
item.description: One year & five months I’ve spent deciding which tailor’s dummy to buy. I saw it in my dreams, it tormented me by thoughts of the tops of draping, which I could conquer with it. The discrepancy between the desired & affordable option drove me into a week of melancholy. The Options Time had passed, & I was still rushing from one option to another. I chose between a soft substandard dummy with short legs for a relatively adequate price & a firm one with a skirt & the shipping price, that cost as much as the dummy itself.

item.title: Fashion Illustration in Design Process
item.description: Imagination takes you to distant cities, introduces to people from other continents & dresses you up in clothes that you have never worn before. If building a new city is problematic, & it is sometimes impossible to find strangers from the dream, sewing a dress is easy. The main thing is to correctly translate the thought from the head to the fabric. I imagine this process as travelling by train from one city to another.

item.title: What Does It Take to Create a Garment? Part 2.
item.description: If you’ve just joined the reading, please, visit the first part page. It tells about inspiration, ideas, ways of getting a pattern & measurements. If you please, I’ll continue. 4. Pattern A pattern is the template, the blueprint, from which the parts of a garment—like sleeves, front & back bodice, collar, etc.—are placed & traced onto fabric before being cut out & assembled. Patterns may be drafted manually or digitally.

item.title: What Does It Take to Create a Garment? Part 1.
item.description: For the first half of my sewing life, I was using ready-made patterns. Unexpectedly, the choice that the magazines provided was not enough, & the decision to create a dress from the beginning to the end came by itself. This was the beginning of a new era. At that moment, I was left alone with my knowledge, skills & a million doubts. There was nothing that could help, no trued pattern, no step-by-step instructions, or even a brief scheme.
